action.action-desc: Mr. Diaz-Balart (for himself, Mr. Campbell, Ms. Bordallo, Mr. Petri, Mr. Roskam, Mr. Holding, Mr. Hall, Mr. Marchant, Mr. Sensenbrenner, Mr. Faleomavaega, Ms. Ros-Lehtinen, Mr. McIntyre, Mr. Higgins, Mr. Griffith of Virginia, Mr. Ryan of Ohio, and Mr. Poe of Texas) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: Recognizing the Falkland Islands referendum in favor of retaining their status as a British Overseas Territory.

whereas.text: Whereas the Falkland Islands have the right, under the United Nations Charter and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, to determine their own future; and
Whereas the United Kingdom is a loyal ally that has stood by the United States: Now, therefore, be it

section.text: That it is the sense of the House of Representatives thatâ€”

paragraph.text: the Falkland Islands have expressed their desire to remain a self-governing British Overseas Territory; and
the views and rights of the Falkland Islanders should be taken into account in any discussion on the future of the Falkland Islands.
